statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Sacred Heart 75, Harvard 66
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Drew Shubik scored a game-high 20 points and hit 10-of-10 free throw attempts in the waning minutes, to give Sacred Heart a 75-66 victory over Harvard on Saturday. The senior also grabbed four rebounds, dished out six assists and was 13-of-14 overall to help the Pioneers (4-7) rebound from a 5-point loss to Providence earlier in the week. Jeremy Lin had a team-high 17 points for Harvard (4-9), but missed two free throws with 3:44 remaining in the second and the score tied at 58-58. Sacred Heart then answered with a 9-0 run over the final 2:56 to put away the Crimson. Junior Ryon Howard contributed 11 points and 12 rebounds, while Brice Brooks, Luke Granato, and Chauncey Hardy each scored in double-digits. Sacred Heart built an early 19-11 lead with 9:50 left in the first half, but Harvard responded and trailed 32-29 at the half. In the second, Lin hit a jumper with 4:51 left to give the Crimson a 57-56 lead, but it was the last advantage they would see the rest of the way. Sacred Heart scored 21 points off Harvard's 20 turnovers.
